Reviews.Title: “Chinatown hotel...disappointment”
Reviews.Author: PY H
Reviews.Content: Not a place to come if you're not a student with a low budget. Very small rooms. Not so clean. Location is the only good thing. Rooms are very practical. Not much else to do in it. Lightswitches didn't work in my room. Staff were slow. Overall, my experience here was subpar. The only reedemable quality was the cheaper price. But I woudln't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable if you are a student with no expectations”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I wanted to walk all of Singapore in a week, so we needed a hotel for long term stay. As we are both students, we needed a budget style accommodation. As you may have discovered, hotels in Singapore are extremely expensive due to the shortage of land and high cost/quality of life. Within the budget hotels range, Chinatown is at the top. It is located in the nicer district and is more safe. We did examine other accommodations such as Pearl and Ruby, but these motels are quite scary. So Chinatown was the best we could get. Here is the thing: if you are a student on a budget, this is the best choice you can make. If you are willing to spend a little more, you can get a much better hotel through a travel agent by adding around 15USD more per night. Since we live in Taiwan, room size was not an issue for us. The room was reasonably sized with adequate lighting and a working air conditioner. The rest was disappointing. The bed cover had a huge stain in the middle. For peace of mind, we assumed it was spilled coffee, though based on the dirt inside the coffee machine, I doubt it was used in the last century. The actual bedding was clean and the bed was reasonably comfortable. What irritated me the most was the shower. Yes the shower is not separated from the toilet area, but if you visited Hong Kong, its nothing special. The problem was, the hot water did not flow properly so we had to shower under a tiny stream of water. Our first experience with housekeeping was also disappointing. We were still in our room at 10am when housekeeper showed up. We asked her to come back later, but she stated that it aint gonna happen. Again we kept our positive spirits and traded some dirty towels in exhange for fresh ones. The second day an older lady was cleaning the place and she was much nicer and did a wonderful job restocking the room and providing us with clean bedding. We did not see any roaches, be it ants or cockroaches. In short, if you just need a place to sleep, Chinatown hotel is acceptable, but if you want more, this is not a place for you. If you demand nothing and expect nothing, you should have an OK stay. The hotel is safe and hotel desk staff is nice (depending on who is onsite, but hey its Singapore). Since its unfair to end on a sad note, I would say the location of the hotel is quite nice, near Chinatown station, within 25 minute walk from the docks and entertainment district, on the purple line that gets you to all major destinations. Chinatown is 5 minutes walk. The hotel is situated within a quiet street and has a few bars around, some more fancy than others. Occasional working lady was spotted in the vicinity but it is not frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs-Ants Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Joeykeong
Reviews.Content: Book a room from through travel agent from China for good location & value for money hotel located in Chinatown area for 4 nights.... Room are basically used for sleeping as my guests are basically out of the hotel for the whole day.....On the second night, found out that the room is infested with lots of ants... I MEANT REALLY lots of ants crawling around the table, the bed frame... taken a video of the crawlers.( So no photos to verify ). Check out on the 3rd day as they have lost total confidence of the hotel cleanliness. Shown the video to the hotel front desk, and the only thing they said is Sorry. Not mentioned of any changing of rooms or any way they ca help.... Just a sorry! It is a disgrace that my guests on holiday had such a bad experience staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location - great, room - small, breakfast - included (toast, cereal), internet pay for and sometimes broken”
Reviews.Author: rmm69
Reviews.Content: The place looks great from the outside and is in a funky part of town. However, the rooms are small so that you can't leave your suitcase opened otherwise there is no room to walk around. The room we had was with a window, which was nice, but the finishing of the room was not really up to standard - the light switches were grubby (not dirty, just old) and the dressing table had a crack in it so that if you were to sit on it you would fall through. BOOM! Tiny TV and the expensive internet which sometimes stopped working were the main reasons I gave this place a poor rating. The staff were friendly - especially the cleaners. In short, not for the sensitive type of traveler but good for people not intending to stay in the room for any length of time other than to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Cramped”
Reviews.Author: shaillender
Reviews.Content: I'll be back; for a single night this hotel is okay. I stayed for 5 days and felt like hell! The rooms are too cramped, and there is hardly any service - no room service, no tea etc. It is some distance from the MRT, but there are food joints around. The hotel staff were not bothered about anyone, they were just there. It's actually like a big house converted into a hotel. You can actually not invite anyone to your room; there is hardly place to stand! Seems that they have carved out space in every nook and corner to make rooms! the breakfast is poor - just porridge, eggs and breads - do it yourself kinds...not much variety, and the restaurant is not at all comfortable - basic seating. All right for just a night stopover, nothing more than that!

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a miss.”
Reviews.Author: IguanaSydney
Reviews.Content: I travel alot and am not unduly fussy but this is not a good hotel for the price. First room, no window. Second room , TV and air con did not work. Generally pretty grubby and uninviting - didn't even bother with breakfast. Had checked in for 2 nights, - but stayed only one which says all. Far better to try the Hotel 1929 across the road which is more or less the same price but infinitely better even though the rooms are small. Clean, good facilities etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worst expereince ever.”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Yip
Reviews.Content: 1. Extremely small room, even without window. 2. No ventialtion in toilet. Smell stayed in the room. 3. Room stinked. Carpet stinked. 4. A big hole in the ceiling. Creepy. 5. Receptionist lied about full occupancy as an excuse not to change our room. I saw people wlaked in and got their rooms. 6. Their one and only one computer was down, The receptionist asked me to fix it for them. 7. If you are travelling in tight budget and this hotel is your only choice, I highly recommend you to cancel your trip. My colleague and I preferred to wander in the hot streets instead of taking rest in our prison-like rooms. 8. Their room rate is not cheap at all compared to many other options in Singapore. The only advantage of this hotel is easy to book. 9. Toilet is so small that you have to shower on your toilet. 10. Internet connection is not free and not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Just disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: mjwilks
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel the world has ever seen! there were hairs in the beds where they obviously haven't been changed. it was hugely noisy so you couldn't sleep. it was filthy filthy dirty where it has never been washed and it looked like it was falling apart from the inside out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice position,shame about the place.”
Reviews.Author: thefc
Reviews.Content: Great location, but thats about it. Place should have been painted about 5 years ago. Walls stained, carpets ripped. No window in room, breakfast, toaster and a teabag. Two nights stay was two nights too long.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but breakfast is a sham”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingdragon
Reviews.Content: The location in Chinatown is perfect and it is really close to the MRT so getting around the rest of the city is very easy. The room had no window, but I did not stay for the views anyway. Other than that, the room is clean even though the interior has definately seen better days (the carpet is old and the room smells a bit old). The breakfast is completely ridiculous, only a toaster and white bread and coffee powder. Good thing is that there is a 7/11 close by and there are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. So it is not a luxury hotel but the staff was friendly and I only wanted a bed and a room in a good location in Singapore and this fitted the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “oh my God'''''''”
Reviews.Author: twotaffs
Reviews.Content: Well what a dissapointment, We travelled from Australia, to singapore and was looking forward to New year in singapore before leaving to the Uk, As we entered the lobby we thought OH MY GOD, then the recipionist handed the key, and it was down hill from there, The room was filthy, the smell was even worse, the bedding had all holes in it, the shower/ toilet was as mouldy as you could get it, and you would not have even wanted the breakfast, a loaf of bread and a dirty toaster, right next to the toilet, which the door didnt shut, I just couldent wait to get back to the airport, How does this sort of hotel be able to stay open, all the bad things you can imagine and far worse was all in one place, We would never never NEVER, stay there again, We will even be taking it further, as false advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel..stay away”
Reviews.Author: wsm99
Reviews.Content: Actually put me in a room with no windows. The shower is also the toilet...TV not connected....overpriced....

Reviews.Title: “The "Fleapit"”
Reviews.Author: SidFromUK
Reviews.Content: How can I put this ? Dire, disgraceful, smelly, uncared for, appalling, dark, tiny rooms, cigarette burns on the bed covers, see-through sheets. paint on the curtains, dirty windows, grouting all over tiles, peeling paint, doors that don't shut properly, no hot water, shower that only drips, rooms without windows, flickering lights, blowing fuses, noisy air-con, sound from other rooms and hallway, generator sounds and vibration, dangling light fittings, damp. Didn't actually see any fleas, but that's what our kids called the place. And finally, there was a sign in reception that said "unregistered guests charged at $20 per night". Decide for yourself what that means. NOT a place to take your loved ones.

Reviews.Title: “This place has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: SarahAustralia
Reviews.Content: What can I say ?.....we stayed here 3 years ago and were quite impressed. However, our recent visit was distinctly disappointing and a complete waste of our money, not being cheap! The room was in severe need of renovation. The paintwork was mouldy. The room was tiny and very dark. The bedding had cigarette burns in it. The curtains were stained. The bathroom was mouldy and the shower spat black bits out and water in all directions except downwards. The air conditioning was very noisy and whole room smelt. The breakfast area had big holes in the wall behind the main table. The only good thing is that the staff were friendly. We definitely would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Here'n'There
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The reception area exuded defeat and disappointment. The receptionist herself seemed surprised that a 'white' guy was staying at the hotel. The rooms were so small that the bed took up 80% of the available space. The tiny lobby was full of shipping crew lounging around with nowhere to go and no money to spend. Breakfast was an obscenity, consisting of a bag of white bread on a side table accompanied by a toaster, do-it-yourself. I think there were some tea bags beside a kettle as well, but I was already on my way out by then. I ended up using my tiny room as storage for my luggage and taking a boat to Indonesia for a couple of days, simply because this hotel was so gosh-darn depressing. I guess some constraints are tolerable if the hotel is really cheap, but this hotel wasn't that cheap! A disaster. I showed the hotel room to one of my Singaporean friends and he told me that he was once looking for a cheap hotel to take a girl for the night and rejected the Chinatown Hotel even on the minimal criteria required for a casual rendezvous after seeing the room. Enough said!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating....”
Reviews.Author: HuaMulan
Reviews.Content: I booked the Chinatown Hotel this summer knowing I wanted a cheap, decent room in the Chinatown area of Singapore. The location was perfect - quiet but convenient to public transport - but the hotel has definitely seen better days. Although the lobby is pleasant enough, the rooms have not received the same upkeep and care. The staff were friendly, but, until the place receives major renovations, it is not value for money. As the previous reviewer noted, there are better hotels on the same street including a very cheery, inviting hostel with private rooms at less cost.

HotelInfo.Name: Chinatown Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 12-16 Teck Lim Rd, Singapore 088388, Singapore
